model

Class Criterion

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Criterion
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class Criterion
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    This is the data structure for a decision criterion, as displayed in the ScenarioTab.

    • Field Detail

      • active

        private boolean active
        An active criterion is considered for the distance calculation. A user can exclude a criterion. This will deactivate it.

        public java.lang.String ID
        The identifier is used for saving purposes. It mustn't include spaces

      • STANDARDS

        public static final java.lang.String STANDARDS
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • value

        private int value
        The current value of this criterion as used for the distance calculation. This can be different depending on the criterion type, e.g. a slider position, or a weight. The value should be between 0 and 100.

      • Criterion

        public Criterion(java.lang.String ID,
         java.lang.String name,
         Scenario scenario)
        This constructor has a single feature. Here the value indicates how important this feature is for the scenario. Creates a new criterion with initial value 50.
        Parameters:
        ID -
        name -
        scenario -

      • Criterion

        public Criterion(java.lang.String ID,
         java.lang.String name,
         Scenario scenario,
         int value)
        This constructor has a single feature. Here the value indicates how important this feature is for the scenario. Loads a criterion with the passed value.
        Parameters:
        ID -
        name -
        scenario -
        value -

      • Criterion

        public Criterion(java.lang.String ID,
         java.lang.String name,
         Scenario scenario,
         java.lang.String leftLabel,
         java.lang.String rightLabel)
        This constructor will create a criterion with two opposing features. The value indicates which of these two features is the most appropriate one for a scenario. Creates a new criterion with initial value 50.
        Parameters:
        ID -
        name -
        scenario -
        leftLabel -
        rightLabel -

        public void setValue(int value)
        Change the value of the criterion. !Special case: if the criterion value is -1, then the criterion is excluded from calculation!
